title: This Boston Marathon bombing survivor is running with Miles for Miracles
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Juliana Hermenegildo, a Boston Marathon bombing survivor, is running the 2026 marathon with the Miles for Miracles team.
Hermengildo aims to raise money for Boston Children's Hospital, where her son Tiago underwent successful heart surgery in 2024.
Running the marathon serves as both a personal healing journey and a mission to support children at Boston Children's Hospital.

title: Teaming up with Al Horford against Celtics will be ‘weird,’ Kristaps Porzingis says
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kristaps Porzingis and Al Horford, former Celtics players, now play for the Golden State Warriors.
Porzingis will debut for the Warriors against the Celtics, having recovered from a POTS and Achilles injury.
Warriors' Stephen Curry will miss the game against the Celtics due to knee pain.

title: Celtics reportedly bring back Dalano Banton on 10-day contract
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Boston Celtics signed Dalano Banton to a 10-day contract; he previously played with the team in 2024.
Banton played with Clippers this season and had brief stints with Raptors, Blazers, and Mavericks over five seasons.
The Celtics also signed John Tonje to a 10-day deal, acquired earlier this month from the Jazz.

title: Here’s why Ed Markey is boycotting the State of the Union — and what he and others are doing instead
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Senator Ed Markey is boycotting President Trump's State of the Union address to attend a rally on the National Mall.
The 'People's State of the Union' event, hosted by MoveOn and MeidasTouch, will feature Democratic lawmakers and activists.
House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries advised Democrats to consider either boycotting Trump's speech or sitting silently through it.

title: South Boston St. Patrick’s Parade to follow new route for 250th Evacuation Day
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: The South Boston St. Patrick's Parade will start at Andrew Square, altering its traditional route for the first time.
The new route commemorates Henry Knox's march and aligns with the 250th Evacuation Day celebration.
Medal of Honor Park will serve as a designated family-friendly zone during the parade on March 15.

title: New England has the best open-air and maritime museums in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Plimoth Patuxet Museums in Plymouth, Massachusetts, was named the No. 1 open-air museum by USA Today readers.
Maine Maritime Museum in Bath, Maine, was ranked as the best maritime museum in the country.
Old Sturbridge Village in Massachusetts and Mystic Seaport Museum in Connecticut ranked No. 3 in their respective categories.

title: Second worker exposed to gas at Maine pulp mill dies
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Allen Hornberger, 26, died after nearly three weeks in critical condition from a toxic gas exposure at Woodland Pulp Mill.
The incident occurred on January 27 during a shutdown process, causing fatal gas exposure to Hornberger and intern Kasie Malcolm.
Hornberger, a North Collins, NY native, was a process engineer at the mill and held a chemical engineering degree.

title: Warriors’ Stephen Curry to miss Thursday’s game against the Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stephen Curry will miss Thursday's game against the Celtics due to ongoing knee pain and swelling.
Curry has not played since January 30, missing 16 games; the Warriors are 6-10 in his absence.
Krastaps Porzingis, acquired from the Hawks, will debut for the Warriors against the Celtics.

title: Local obituary: Bob Aliano, worked as a Roslindale barber for 67 years
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Bob Aliano, former owner of Rialto Barber Shop in Roslindale, passed away on February 14, 2026.
Aliano worked at The Rialto Barber Shop in Roslindale since 1959, making countless friends and loyal customers.
Visiting hours are Sunday, February 22, with funeral services on Monday, February 23, at St. Theresa of Avila Church.

title: Red Sox infielder Caleb Durbin discussed how wrestling background helps with fielding
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Caleb Durbin, recently acquired by the Red Sox, credits his wrestling background for his quick defensive movements.
Durbin, who primarily played third base for the Brewers, could be utilized at second base by manager Alex Cora.
Durbin has a history of athleticism from his high school wrestling days and was noted for mental toughness by his coaches.
